ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: This course was very poorly organized. The professor missed two weeks of seminars and cancelled office hours frequently. He changed the syllabus in major ways at short notice.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: This is a really fascinating course and Professor Amanat is a true expert. There was more cultural and religious history than I expected, and I am glad for it, because it's much more interesting than just viewing Iran through the lens of European and American foreign policy. Professor Amanat was a little busy doing publicity for his new book, so the structure was at times somewhat confusing, but he was always very helpful when I had questions about how to write my essay.
